text: So what's the layering between KA, KernelCompiler and Loopvec? It's in that order?

elements.text: So what's the layering between KA, KernelCompiler and Loopvec? It's in that order?

text: KC is going to be the compiler/runtime for KA's CPU implementation, but LoopVec has nothing to do with those. LoopVec is only helpful because sometimes LLVM doesn't think it's safe/beneficial to vectorize the loop. Once Valentin's LoopInfo PR is merged, LLVM will probably have enough information to start vectorizing more loops.

elements.text: KC is going to be the compiler/runtime for KA's CPU implementation, but LoopVec has nothing to do with those. text: LoopVec is a band-aid over missing optimizations

elements.text: LoopVec is a band-aid over missing optimizations

text:
> Once Valentin's LoopInfo PR is merged, LLVM will probably have enough information to start vectorizing more loops.
I wouldn't word it that strongly, we are still missing quite a bit of other information.
